01.description: Clavicus Vile is one of the seventeen most powerful Daedra known as Daedric Princes. He is best known for granting wishes, often in ways that turn out poorly for the recipient.
01.name: Clavicus Vile

13.description: Meridia (who once bore the name Merid-Nunda) is one of the Daedra whose sphere of influence is beyond the control of mortals. She is associated with the energy of living beings and, unlike most Daedra, is not considered unequivocally evil.
13.name: Meridia

02.description: Sheogorath is the Daedric Prince of Madness, known by the nicknames Madman, Mad Lord, Mad Star, Prince of Madness. His Plan in Oblivion is the Shivering Islands or the House of Madness. The islands are divided into two realms: Mania, home of the mad, adoring luxury, lovers of the arts and lavish revelry, and Dementia, a dark, dark, horror-filled land inhabited to match the twisted nature.
02.name: Sheogorath

16.description: Sanguine is the Prince of drunkenness and debauchery. His sphere is the darker sides of human nature, such as lust, laziness, gluttony and greed. Although Sanguine likes jokes, he likes even more to push mortals into the path of vice through temptation and humiliation. He patronizes sinners and is often depicted with a bottle of wine or beer in his hand.
16.name: Sanguine

05.description: Hermaeus Mora, or Herma Mora, is a Daedric prince whose sphere is the prediction of fate, past and future by reading the stars and the firmament. He is the lord of knowledge and memory.
05.name: Hermaeus Mora

21.description: Azura, whose sphere is dawn and dusk, is the Queen of the realm of twilight; known by such names as the Prince of Moon Shadow, Queen of the Evening Sky, and Mother of the Rose. She is the sister of Nocturnal. Azura is one of the most gracious and benevolent of the Daedra Lords, but she is also fierce and ruthless.
21.name: Azura

09.description: Peryite is one of the seventeen Daedra Princes who live in Oblivion. His sphere of influence is the natural order, disease, and epidemics.
09.name: Peryite

09.description: Namira is a Daedra Princess whose sphere is ancient darkness. She is also known as the Lady of Decay, the Spirit of the Daedra, and the Goddess of Darkness. Namira is the lord of various dark spirits. She is often associated with spiders, insects, slugs, and other disgusting creatures that inspire instinctive disgust in mortals.
09.name: Namira

05.description: Hircine is one of the Daedra princes whose domain is hunting, jousting Daedra, the greatest game, stalking and sacrificing mortals.
05.name: Hircine

10.description: Vaermina, or the Dreamweaver, is one of the Daedra Princes. Her sphere of influence includes dreams, nightmares, fears, and torture, as well as ominous omens and stealing memories.
10.name: Vaermina

08.description: Nocturnal is a Daedric Princess whose realm is night and darkness. She is also known as the Lady Luck, Mistress of Shadows, and Ur-dra.
08.name: Nocturnal

08.description: Malacath is a Daedric Prince, protector of the scorned and rejected, guardian of the Faithful Oaths and Blood Curses. Malacath patronizes the orsimers.
08.name: Malacath

13.description: Princess Daedra Mephala is known as the Spinner of the Nets, the Spinner, and the Spiderwoman. Her domain is lies, sex, murder, secrets and conspiracies, and she also likes to seduce mortals and meddle in their affairs.
13.name: Mephala

02.description: Boethiah is an insidious god whose sphere is deception and conspiracy, dastardly murder, treason, and the overthrow of power.
02.name: Boethiah

20.description: Mehrunes Dagon is the Daedric Prince of Destruction, change, revolution, energy and ambition. He is associated with natural hazards such as fire, earthquakes and floods. Dagon is an important deity in Morrowind, where he is associated with its landscape, so unsuitable for life. In most cultures, however, Dagon is simply the god of bloodshed and treachery.
20.name: Mehrunes Dagon

20.description: Molag Bal is a Daedric Prince of domination and enslavement of mortals. He is also known as the Prince of Intrigue and the Reaper of Souls. His main ambition is to reap and consume the souls of mortals, to subjugate them to his power, and to sow the seeds of discord in the mortal world. Molag Bal is the father of all vampires.
20.name: Molag Bal
